etymology.description: semantic: 口 ‘mouth’ + phonetic: 力 (lì); also noted in 玉篇校釋 as a simplified form of 別/别.
etymology.interpretation: Mouth suggests a semantic field related to speech or counted units, while 力 contributes the lì ~ lìng pronunciation. Historical sources also link it graphically to 別 ‘to separate,’ aligning with meanings like ‘other’ and ‘separate.’

examples.chinese: 我们需要另一个方案(我們需要另一個方案)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen xūyào lìng yí gè fāng'àn.

examples.chinese: 费用另算，邮资另付(費用另算，郵資另付)。
examples.pinyin: Fèiyòng lìng suàn, yóuzī lìng fù.
examples.english: Fees are calculated separately; postage is paid separately.

examples.chinese: 会议时间待定，另行通知(會議時間待定，另行通知)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì shíjiān dàidìng, lìng xíng tōngzhī.
examples.english: The meeting time is to be determined and will be announced separately.
